attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status of CCI-000132 compliance based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. High scores may indicate hosts sending logs with timestamps not in UTC.
attributes.title: [CCI-000132] Content of Audit Records: UTC Timestamps ML

attributes.description:
This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-000132, which requires that audit records contain timestamps in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). You will find visualizations that identify systems not reporting in UTC and show the overall compliance status.

To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' to focus on a specific system. The primary goal is to ensure that the 'event.timezone' for all logs is either '+00:00' or 'Z'. Any host reporting a different timezone is non-compliant and requires investigation. The visualizations below will help you quickly identify these systems.
attributes.title: [CCI-000132] Content of Audit Records: UTC Timestamps
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CCI-000132] Content of Audit Records: UTC Timestamps","type":"markdown","aggs":[],"params":{"markdown":"# [AU-3 CCI-000132] [AU.L2-3.3] Content of Audit Records\n\n### Ensure event times are expressed in UTC.","fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false}}

attributes.description:
This donut chart provides a high-level overview of UTC timestamp compliance across all monitored hosts.

**Why this visualization works:**
It offers an immediate visual summary of your compliance posture. The color-coded sections make it easy to see the proportion of compliant versus non-compliant systems at a glance, which is ideal for dashboards and executive reporting.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use this chart to quickly assess the overall health of UTC compliance. The 'Compliant' slice (representing timezones '+00:00' or 'Z') should ideally be 100%. Any other slices represent non-compliant systems. Click on a non-compliant slice to filter the dashboard and see more details about the specific hosts in that category.
attributes.title: [CCI-000132] UTC Timestamp Compliance Overview (converted)

attributes.description:
This metric displays the total number of unique hosts that are NOT sending logs with a UTC timestamp.

**Why this visualization works:**
It provides a single, critical number that quantifies the scope of non-compliance. A value of zero indicates full compliance, while any other number shows exactly how many systems require immediate attention.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Monitor this number as a key performance indicator for UTC compliance. If the count is greater than zero, it confirms that there are non-compliant systems in the environment. Use this metric as a starting point to justify further investigation using the compliance matrix and other tools to identify and remediate the specific hosts.

query.query: event.timezone : * and not event.timezone : ("+00:00" or "Z" or "UTC")

attributes.title: [CCI-000132] Non-Compliant Host Count

attributes.description:
This data table provides a compliance matrix showing each host and its most recently reported timezone. It is the primary tool for identifying non-compliant systems.

**Why this visualization works:**
It offers a clear, actionable list of every component and its timestamp reporting status. This allows for precise identification of systems that need remediation to meet the UTC requirement.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Review the 'event.timezone' column. Any value other than '+00:00' or 'Z' indicates a non-compliant host. Sort by this column to group non-compliant systems together. You can then use the 'host.name' to begin your investigation and remediation process for each identified component.
attributes.title: [CCI-000132] Host Timezone Compliance Matrix (converted)

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table provides the detailed context needed to investigate timestamp anomalies identified by the ML job for CCI-000132. It pinpoints the exact hosts and the anomalous timezones they are reporting, allowing for targeted remediation.

**How to Use:** Review this table to identify hosts with high maximum anomaly scores. The `host.name` and `event.timezone` fields show which systems are deviating from their normal behavior. To investigate, filter the dashboard by a specific `host.name` from this table and examine the raw logs around the time of the anomaly to diagnose the configuration issue.
attributes.title: [AU-3, CCI-000132] ML - Top Non-UTC Timestamp Anomalies
